Package algorithms.matrix

Class BlockMatrixIsometric

java.lang.Object
algorithms.matrix.BlockMatrixIsometric
public class BlockMatrixIsometric extends Object
a class to hold a matrix that is partitioned into blocks of the same size.
Author:
nichole

  • Constructor Details

    • BlockMatrixIsometric

      public BlockMatrixIsometric(double[][] a, int bSize0, int bSize1)
      constructor. The matrix a is not copied in. This is a pass-by-reference constructor.
      Parameters:
      a -
      bSize0 - block size along the first dimension (rows)
      bSize1 - block size along the second dimension (columns)

  • Method Details

    • reset

      public void reset()
      set all values to 0

    • fill

      void fill(double value)

    • setBlock

      public void setBlock(double[][] b, int blockNumber0, int blockNumber1)
      set values in internal matrix a for block number (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) to the given block b. b must be the same size as the block size of this instance.
      Parameters:
      b - a given block of values to replace a block of this instance with.
      blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
      blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

    • setRowBlock

      public void setRowBlock(double[] b, int blockNumber0, int blockNumber1)
      set values in internal matrix a for block number (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) to the given row block b which is a single dimension array. b.length must equal this.bSize1, and this.bSize0 must equal 1.
      Parameters:
      b - a given block of values in a single dimension array to replace a block of this instance with.
      blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
      blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

    • setColumnBlock

      public void setColumnBlock(double[] b, int blockNumber0, int blockNumber1)
      set values in internal matrix a for block number (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) to the given column block b which is a single dimension array. b.length must equal this.bSize0, and this.bSize1 must equal 1.
      Parameters:
      b - a given block of values in a single dimension array to replace a block of this instance with.
      blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
      blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

    • getBlock

      public double[][] getBlock(int blockNumber0, int blockNumber1)
      get values in internal matrix a for block number (blockNumber0, blockNumber1)
      Parameters:
      blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
      blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.
      Returns:
      contents of (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) of matrix a in this instance.

    • getBlock

      public void getBlock(double[][] b, int blockNumber0, int blockNumber1)
      get values in internal matrix a for block number (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) and set them into the given block b.
      Parameters:
      b - the output block for the contents of (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) of matrix a in this instance.
      blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
      blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

    • getRowBlock

      public void getRowBlock(double[] b, int blockNumber0, int blockNumber1)
      get values in internal matrix a for block number (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) and set them into the given row block b.
      Parameters:
      b - the output row block for the contents of (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) of matrix a in this instance.
      blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
      blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

    • getColumnBlock

      public void getColumnBlock(double[] b, int blockNumber0, int blockNumber1)
      get values in internal matrix a for block number (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) and set them into the given column block b.
      Parameters:
      b - the output column block for the contents of (blockNumber0, blockNumber1) of matrix a in this instance.
      blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
      blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

    • addToBlock

      public void addToBlock(double[][] b, int blockNumber0, int blockNumber1)
      add block b to internal matrix, pointwise, for (blockNumber0, blockNumber1). b must be the same size as the block size of this instance.
      Parameters:
      b - a given block of values to add to a block of this instance.
      blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
      blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

    • addToColumnBlock

      public void addToColumnBlock(double[] b, int blockNumber0, int blockNumber1)
      add column block b to internal matrix, pointwise, for (blockNumber0, blockNumber1). b must be the same size as the block size of this instance, including this.bSize1 must equal 1 at construction.
      Parameters:
      b - a given column block of values to add to a block of this instance.
      blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
      blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

    • addToRowBlock

      public void addToRowBlock(double[] b, int blockNumber0, int blockNumber1)
      add row block b to internal matrix, pointwise, for (blockNumber0, blockNumber1). b must be the same size as the block size of this instance, including this.bSize0 must equal 1 at construction.
      Parameters:
      b - a given row block of values to add to a block of this instance.
      blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
      blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

    • subtractFromBlock

      public void subtractFromBlock(double[][] b, int blockNumber0, int blockNumber1)
      subtract block b from internal matrix, pointwise, for (blockNumber0, blockNumber1). b must be the same size as the block size of this instance.
      Parameters:
      b - a given block of values to replace a block of this instance with.
      blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
      blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

    • subtractFromColumnBlock

      public void subtractFromColumnBlock(double[] b, int blockNumber0, int blockNumber1)
      subtract column block b from internal matrix, pointwise, for (blockNumber0, blockNumber1). b must be the same size as the block size of this instance, including this.bSize1 must equal 1 at construction.
      Parameters:
      b - a given column block of values to subtract from a block of this instance.
      blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
      blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

    • subtractFromRowBlock

      public void subtractFromRowBlock(double[] b, int blockNumber0, int blockNumber1)
      subtract row block b from internal matrix, pointwise, for (blockNumber0, blockNumber1). b must be the same size as the block size of this instance, including this.bSize0 must equal 1 at construction.
      Parameters:
      b - a given row block of values to subtract from a block of this instance.
      blockNumber0 - the number of the block along the first dimension, that is, rows.
      blockNumber1 - the number of the block along the second dimension, that is, columns.

      public double[][] getA()
      get the entire matrix of this instance. Note that this is a reference to the instance and is not a copy of it, so modifications of the returned matrix affect this instance too.

      the a
